name: Nazia Ahmed
bio:
Nazia is a sophomore majoring in Neuroscience at UT Dallas. Aside from being an officer in the AIS, she 
			  also works as a Research Assistant in the Thompson Lab and as a Medical Scribe at the Baylor University 
			  Medical Center. She has also worked at the Robotics Institute at Carnegie Mellon University, and has spent 
			  several years volunteering as a math tutor for youth in the Dallas area. As a Neuroscience major with experience 
			  in Computer Science, Nazia aspires to contribute a biological perspective to provide a more comprehensive 
			  understanding of AI. She also has a passion for inspiring youth to pursue STEM fields.
